law.catch_line: A telegraph or telephone company or a corporation authorized under § 5-410(a)(3) of this article ma...

section.section: The company may erect fixtures, including poles, piers, or abutments necessary to sustain the lines.
This section does not authorize a company to construct a bridge across any of the navigable waters of the State.

text.section:
A line constructed under subsection (a) of this section is not a public nuisance and is not subject to abatement by a private party if the line does not interfere with or disturb:
the public use of roads, highways, and bridges;
the navigation of the waters of the State; or
the convenience of a landowner more than is unavoidable.
